intro: Calycothrix laricina, commonly known as the redstem mouseear, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its roots are fibrous and can be used in traditional herbal medicine. Calycothrix laricina thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
